intro: Aulacospermum tenuilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed aulacospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments.
